titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Edward Fingerhood (1937-1998) was an amateur ornithologist and philatelist. He served as vice president of the Valley Forge Audubon Society and a councillor of the Delaware Valley Ornithological Club. He was also a wildlife technician with the Pennsylvania Game Commission, monitoring the peregrine falcon population in the Philadelphia area.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the birding records and notes of Edward Fingerhood. Materials include: bird checklists, notes on and photocopies of general ornithological works and on specific topics, such as the sense of smell in vultures; a manuscript by Fingerhood of "Memorandum on the Chukar in Pennsylvania"; Fingerhood's annotations to the "Field List of the Birds of the Delaware Valley Region" by Brady, Bell, and Lipschutz; logs of peregrine and osprey sightings; bibliographic notes and lists; a card file of bird sightings by species; audio tapes of birdcalls from a variety of sources; and a small number of snapshots of birds.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
